intro: Agoseris leptocarpa, commonly known as the slenderleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Agoseris leptocarpa is often found in disturbed soils and can form dense colonies in suitable environments.
